text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
ice cream cake pop tutorial where I'll
be showing you how to make these
gorgeous little ice cream cake pops I
first saw this idea on an awesome blog
Nina banks so I will leave a link to her
blog in the description box below
but she had a new take on a traditional
favorite so we've done ice cream cake
pops before but these ones were just so
cute and cartoony I absolutely had to
share them with you so tools and
equipment that we will be using today
I've got some Jaffer's these are just a
red chalk orange ball that we buy here
in Australia but you could substitute
these for peanut M&Ms or any round candy
in any color you like I've got some
sprinkles I've got some pink candy melts
because I'm going to do this strawberry
chocolate ice cream today I've got some
melted dark chocolate or milk chocolate
I've got a serrated edge knife I've got
one of the little flat bottom icecream
cones
I've got two cakepop balls for each of
these ice cream cake pops so one of them
has been refrigerated and one of them
has been not one is going to be for the
bottom of the cone and one is gonna be
the little I guess the bowl that sits on
top I've got a pair of scissors and a
ziplock bag so let's get started now the
cute factor on these I think is that
they're mini so anything mini is always
gorgeous so you want to take your ice
cream cone and you can decide how big or
how small you want these you can see
with my little one in the middle there
he's a little bit smaller than the other
two I'm just gonna cut mine about half
an inch or so below that line the
serrated edge knife is going to give you
a little bit of a saw effect and it's
going to soar through without breaking
your cone and don't worry too much if
it's not perfectly even so now you want
to take your unrefrigerated cake ball so
this one has been in the fridge for 15
minutes if you don't have a great recipe
for cake pops I will leave a link to our
recipe in the description box below
we've basically rolled as per the recipe
this one's been refrigerated 15 minutes
and this one hasn't so the one that
hasn't I'm just going to roll it into a
little bit of an oval just between the
palm of my hands and I'm gonna shove it
into the base of that cake pot you want
to push that all the way down and then
you're just going to trim off any excess
so how much you use will depend on the
size of the cone that you've decided to
try
and the size of the coin that you've
bought so I'm just gonna trim off that
excess so I've got a nice flat top
perfect now you want to take a little
bit of that melted dark chocolate you're
just gonna take your cake pop ball it
should have a bit of a naturally flat
bottom just from where it's been setting
in the refrigerator dip that ever so
slightly you just want a little bit of
that melted chocolate on the bottom and
then sit it on top that melted
chocolates gonna act like a glue now you
want to let that completely set once
that's completely set we can get on to
dipping and decorating up gorgeous
little ice cream cone cake pops so the
first color that we want to do is going
to be a layer of our bright color so for
me it's gonna be pink and I need to dip
that all the way down just to the line
and then we're going to shake it off a
little bit so I'm just gonna dip that
down into my melted pink chocolate and
then I'm gonna bring it up a tiny little
shake off there but you really want to
turn it straight back upside down and
you want to tap your wrist which is
going to cause that chocolate to drizzle
down nicely in our kind of cartoony
droople effect kind of like the ice
cream is melting a little bit perfect so
now you want to let that layer dry and
then we'll do our second layer of color
all right so that pink layer has set
nice and dry to the touch so now you
want to take your second layer which for
me is gonna be dark chocolate and I'm
just gonna dip it to about yeah so about
a third of the way or even a quarter of
a way down that first dipping so pop it
in give it a little twirl and once again
don't shake off too much of that excess
turn it upside down back up the right
way you can't even tap your cake pop and
your whole hand in fact on the bench a
little bit just to encourage those
little layers to dribble down a bit so
you should now have something that looks
a little bit like this we're gonna let
that second layer of color completely
dry and then we'll come back and we'll
be ready to finish it off all right so
both of our first two color layers are
now set and it's time to just put on our
final color and finish it off so now you
just pick a ziplock bag and just pour in
a little bit of your pink or whatever
color you're using and we push that all
the way down to the end make sure you
seal your bag and let out all the air as
always and then we're just gonna cut off
kind of a bit of a chunky corner it
doesn't have to be too fine for this
because we really want to have that nice
big chunky cartoony kind of blobby
effect and then you're just gonna
squeeze it out onto your cake pop so you
can see there I'm just squeezing almost
like a little bit of a flower pattern
and then you want to just give it a few
good hard taps and let that beautiful
candy melt just dribble all the way down
the sides turn it around you can make
sure that you're sort of distributing it
relatively evenly so I'm just tilting
the cake pop as I as I tap it now before
that dries or sets too much take some of
your sprinkles and just sprinkle them on
the top and on the sides perfect I've
managed to make quite a nice little mess
there now you might just need to get a
little bit more of that candy mount to
fix your little M&M or your jaffa so I'm
just gonna put a little blob of candy
mount on the back of my Jaffa and sit it
straight on top so there you've got your
art early gorgeous little cartoony style
standalone ice cream cake pop I love
these because there's no need for cake
pop containers they stand by themselves
they look absolutely gorgeous they go
with so many different party events
carnival parties girls boys it really
doesn't matter I hope that you guys love
them as much as I do
and thanks very much Nina bakes for the
fantastic idea thanks very much for
watching my cupcake addiction
